name: Canonical Disclosure Intent Registry ? Complete
description: Complete registry of canonical disclosure intents across all domains.

intents.name: Gross Scope 1 Emissions
intents.definition: Total direct greenhouse gas emissions from owned or controlled sources.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary defined by equity share or operational control.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period aligned to fiscal or calendar year.
intents.stabilityNote: Definitionally stable since Kyoto Protocol.

intents.name: Gross Scope 2 Emissions
intents.definition: Indirect greenhouse gas emissions from purchased electricity, steam, heating, or cooling.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary aligned to energy consumption accounting.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period synchronized to energy billing cycles.
intents.stabilityNote: Core concept stable since introduction of Scope categorization.

intents.name: Gross Scope 3 Emissions
intents.definition: All indirect greenhouse gas emissions in the value chain not included in Scope 2.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Value chain boundary defined by entity's goods and services flow.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period may vary by category.
intents.stabilityNote: Broadest and most methodologically diverse scope.

intents.name: Carbon Removals
intents.definition: Quantified removal of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary defined by ownership or control of removal activity.
intents.temporalApplicability: Temporal applicability defined by durability period of removal.
intents.stabilityNote: Emerging disclosure intent gaining structural prominence.

intents.name: Net Emissions
intents.definition: Algebraic sum of gross greenhouse gas emissions across all scopes minus quantified carbon removals.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary determined by aggregation of component metrics.
intents.temporalApplicability: Temporal alignment across component metrics required.
intents.stabilityNote: Arithmetically definitional: emissions minus removals.

intents.name: Emissions Intensity
intents.definition: Ratio of greenhouse gas emissions to a specified denominator representing entity output, activity, or scale.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary defined by numerator metric. Denominator boundary defined by financial or operational accounting convention.
intents.temporalApplicability: Temporal alignment of numerator and denominator required.
intents.stabilityNote: Ratiometric concept structurally stable.

intents.name: Existence of Emissions Reduction Target
intents.definition: Declarative disclosure indicating whether the entity has established a formal target for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary defined by entity organizational perimeter.
intents.temporalApplicability: Target existence assessed at reporting date.
intents.stabilityNote: Binary existence disclosure semantically simple and stable.

intents.name: Progress Against Emissions Reduction Target
intents.definition: Measurement of actual emissions performance relative to established reduction target baseline.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary must align with target boundary.
intents.temporalApplicability: Progress assessed at reporting date relative to target baseline.
intents.stabilityNote: Comparative disclosure structure stable: actual versus target.

intents.name: Existence of Climate Transition Plan
intents.definition: Declarative disclosure indicating whether the entity has established a formal climate transition plan.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Boundary typically at entity or consolidated group level.
intents.temporalApplicability: Plan existence assessed at reporting date.
intents.stabilityNote: Binary existence disclosure semantically stable.

intents.name: Renewable Energy Consumption
intents.definition: Quantity of energy consumed by the entity derived from renewable sources.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary defined by equity share or operational control.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period aligned to energy billing and generation cycles.
intents.stabilityNote: Core energy accounting concept stable.

intents.name: Baseline year for climate targets
intents.definition: The baseline period used for setting climate-related targets, establishing the reference point against which progress is measured.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary aligned with target scope.
intents.temporalApplicability: Baseline year defined as single calendar year or multi-year average.
intents.stabilityNote: Baseline selection is methodologically stable once established.

intents.name: Target year(s) for climate targets
intents.definition: The target period(s) for achieving climate-related targets, specifying the timeframe by which objectives must be met.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Target scope aligned with organizational boundary.
intents.temporalApplicability: Target years defined as specific calendar years.
intents.stabilityNote: Target year selection remains stable unless strategic objectives change.

intents.name: Scope coverage of climate targets
intents.definition: The scopes, boundaries, or value-chain segments covered by climate-related targets, defining the organizational and operational scope of commitments.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Target boundary may include specific subsidiaries, geographic regions, or operational units.
intents.temporalApplicability: Scope coverage defined at target establishment.
intents.stabilityNote: Target scope definition is structurally stable.

intents.name: Transition plan existence
intents.definition: The existence of a documented plan to achieve climate-related targets, indicating formal strategic planning for climate transition.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Plan scope typically at entity or consolidated group level.
intents.temporalApplicability: Plan existence assessed at reporting date.
intents.stabilityNote: Binary existence disclosure semantically stable.

intents.name: Key actions in climate transition plan
intents.definition: The principal actions or measures planned to achieve climate-related targets, outlining the strategic initiatives in the transition plan.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Actions scoped to organizational boundary.
intents.temporalApplicability: Actions defined with implementation timelines and milestone dates.
intents.stabilityNote: Action descriptions remain stable unless transition strategy changes.

intents.name: Gross Scope 1 greenhouse gas emissions
intents.definition: Total direct greenhouse gas emissions from owned or controlled sources, including combustion, process emissions, and transportation.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary defined by equity share or operational control.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period aligned to fiscal or calendar year.
intents.stabilityNote: Definitionally stable since Kyoto Protocol.

intents.name: Gross Scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions
intents.definition: Indirect greenhouse gas emissions from the generation of purchased electricity, steam, heating, or cooling consumed by the entity.
intents.boundaryApplicability: Organizational boundary aligned to energy consumption accounting.
intents.temporalApplicability: Reporting period synchronized to energy billing cycles.

intents.name: Scope 2 accounting approach
